title: MR-184: Feature request: Credential repository
author: viandham
body_snippet:
I would like to suggest a credential repository, so we can reference a specific set of credentials for each connection.
I, for example, have > 100 servers added in a specific windows domain. Password policy kicks in and forces me to update my passwords, now 100 entries are faulty. Instead, with a credential respository, I would update the master credential and this would apply to all linked connections.

Otherwise, thanks for a great application!

iterations.description: Credential repository is a major architectural feature requiring new infrastructure (vault integration, credential provider API, UI redesign) that is out of scope for the current fork's maintenance-focused roadmap

comments.author: AndrewSav
comments.snippet:
There are a lot of different secret storages out there [thycotic secret server](https://thycotic.com/products/secret-server/), [Hashicorp Vault](https://www.vaultproject.io/), [Ansible Vault](https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/2.4/vault.html). One would prefer store their secrets in a backend they are already using for secret storage.

Thus it would be very nice feature if mRemoteNG Credential Manager could store secrets in this and other popular secret backends.
Would be ideal for it to also look in Windows Credential Store that is local on all Windows boxes.
